interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Vera: Set 7 Review Date: 2017/12/15 Store: Brenda Blethyn (Actor), Kenny Doughty (Actor), Jamie Childs (Director), Louise Hooper (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, British Television Product Description: ['OSCAR NOMINEE BRENDA BLETHYN (Pride and Prejudice, Atonement) returns as Detective Chief Inspector Vera Stanhope in this acclaimed mystery series inspired by the novels of Ann Cleeves. Against the stunning backdrop of rural Northumberland, Vera and her assistant, Detective Sergeant Aiden Healy (Kenny Doughty, Stella, Black Work), strive to solve vicious crimes that menace their community. This season finds Vera and Aiden investigating several mysterious deaths, including a park ranger found washed up on the shores of a remote wildlife reserve, a drug addict, a promising young journalism student, and a woman who had disappeared six weeks earlier. Despite her unconventional ways and abrasive personality, Vera continues to captivate in this long-running British mystery that is “sheer heaven for fans of police procedurals” (The Philadelphia Inquirer).'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Mystery & Suspense/British Mystery Theater, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Jamie Childs, Kenny Doughty, Louise Hooper, John Hayes, Brenda Blethyn, Lee Haven Jones', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '4', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.61 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'AMP2613', 'Director': 'Jamie Childs, Louise Hooper, Lee Haven Jones, John Hayes', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '6 hours and 13 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 24, 2017', 'Actors': 'Brenda Blethyn, Kenny Doughty', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Acorn', 'Number of discs': '4'} Review Text: Very involved and convoluted stories.
Vera is less disheveled and cranky than in series 1-6. Miss her snarky comments to her underlings. Review Title: Sharp but Less Snarky! Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

This is the True Dunkirk Dirty Dancing: 30th Anniversary Digital Jennifer Grey (Actor), Patrick Swayze (Actor), Emile Ardolino (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies ['Product Description', "Its the summer of 1963 and Baby is stuck at the Catskills with her parents. Attempting to make the best of the situation, Baby attends the organized classes on merengue dancing and wig demonstration. Suddenly, all of that changes when she meets Johnny Castle, the resort's dance instructor. With Johnny, Baby learns the steps to a new dance--a dirty dance--that allows her to discover new strengths and new talents in order to define her place in a rapidly changing world. profile:
**User Summary Updated:**

- **Rating Preference:** The user maintains a positive rating average around 4.5, recently awarding a perfect score to a mystery series, indicating their appreciation for intricate plots and strong character dynamics.

- **Content Appreciation:** They enjoy narratives featuring a blend of complex storytelling, showcasing a preference for both emotional depth and engaging, convoluted plots, which can evoke strong reactions.

- **Character Focus:** The user values nuanced portrayals across various genres, including mysteries. They appreciate interactions that highlight character development, particularly in series where humor, even when subtler, complements dramatic arcs.

- **Storytelling Styles:** Their preference leans towards narratives that emphasize emotional and intellectual engagement, reflecting an interest in stories that challenge as well as entertain.

- **Specific Genre Affinity:** The user has shown an increasing interest in mystery and suspense alongside their established love for romantic dramas, highlighting their growing appreciation for character-driven stories that unfold in intricate layers.

- **Cultural Elements:** They remain drawn to stories that resonate universally, expertly balancing lighthearted elements with deeper explorations of human connections.

- **Language & Accessibility:** The user continues to favor accessible narratives that engage a broad audience, enriching their viewing experience.

Overall, they consistently seek out depth and complexity, particularly in content that intertwines emotional journeys with compelling character interactions, regardless of genre.
